TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SignatureLineCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public MustInherit Class SignatureLineCollection Implements IEnumerable
public ref class SignatureLineCollection abstract : System::Collections::IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Contains all objects in the current view, which represent the Signature Line controls in that view.

remarks.para: This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.
To access the for the current view, use the property of the class.

The order of the objects in the collection corresponds to the value of the Tab index property assigned to each control when you add it to the view. To specify that value, open the form template in the InfoPath designer, right-click the control, click Signature Line Properties, click Advanced, and then set the Tab index property of the control.

Important: When a form template has more than one view and other views contain Signature Line controls, be aware that looping through an instance of the accesses only the set of objects that represent the Signature Line controls in the current view. To access the objects for the Signature Line controls in other views, you must use the method to switch to a different view before looping through that view's .

example.para: The following code example shows how to return the associated with the current view.

Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: abstract property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of objects in the .
Docs.value: The number of objects in the collection.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: The following code example displays the count of signature lines in the current view.
example.code: Dim mySignatures As SignatureLineCollection = _ Me.CurrentView.SignatureLines MessageBox.Show("There are " & mySignatures.Count.ToString() & _ " signature lines in the current view.")

Public MustOverride Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Gets a object that iterates over all entries in the .
Docs.returns: An enumerator for iterating over the entries in the collection.

remarks.para: The order of the objects in the collection corresponds to the value of the Tab index property assigned to each control when you add it to the view.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: The following code example iterates over the entire collection of objects and displays the value of the property associated with each signature.
example.code: Dim mySignatures As SignatureLineCollection = _ Me.CurrentView.SignatureLines Dim sigEnum As System.Collections.IEnumerator = _ mySignatures.GetEnumerator() While sigEnum.MoveNext() MessageBox.Show(DirectCast(sigEnum.Current, SignatureLine) _ .Signature.Comment.ToString()) End While

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.SignatureLine this[int index] { get; }
Default Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Item(index As Integer) As SignatureLine
public: abstract property Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::SignatureLine ^ default[int] { Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::SignatureLine ^ get(int index); };

Docs.param: The zero-based index for the object to return. The value specified must be a number from 0 to the value of the collection's property minus 1.
Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the specified object from the .
Docs.value: An object that represents a Signature Line control in the collection.

remarks.para: The order of the objects in the collection corresponds to the value of the Tab index property assigned to each control when you add it to the view.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: The following code example iterates over the entire collection of objects and displays the value of the property associated with each signature.
example.code: Dim mySignatures As SignatureLineCollection = _ Me.CurrentView.SignatureLines For Each myLine As SignatureLine In mySignatures MessageBox.Show(myLine.Signature.Comment.ToString()) Next

Docs.exception: The parameter passed to this method is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The parameter passed to this method is not valid. For example, it is of the wrong type or format.
